definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: He romped home in the marathon race.
sentences.chinese: 他在马拉松赛跑中轻而易举地获胜。

sentences.english: Let's say, your brother just ran a marathon.
sentences.chinese: 假设你的哥哥参加了一场马拉松赛跑。

sentences.english: I'm you the Hilltop School Skating Marathon.
sentences.chinese: 我是在高山学校溜冰马拉松赛的现场向您报道。

sentences.english: It is said that people can see some marathons in ChangbaiMountains every year.
sentences.chinese: 据说人们每年在常白山能看到一些马拉松赛。

sentences.english: Why do the vast majority of people who start the marathon complete it?
sentences.chinese: 为什么大多数完成马拉松赛的人们会这样做呢？

sentences.english: He set up a new national record in the marathon race.
sentences.chinese: 他创造了马拉松赛跑的全国新记录。

sentences.english: This year she is in Xiamen Marathon in London after the end of the title.
sentences.chinese: 今年她就是在厦门马拉松赛结束后再于伦敦折桂的。

sentences.english: Auntie Pasto's … great place to carbo-load before the marathon.
sentences.chinese: 这是马拉松赛前吸收碳水化合物的好地方。

sentences.english: I used it to maintain muscle mass while training for the San Diego Marathon.
sentences.chinese: 我在备战圣地亚哥马拉松赛时用它来锻炼肌肉力量。

sentences.english: People lined the streets to watch marathon.
sentences.chinese: 人们夹道观看马拉松赛跑。

sentences.english: He has taken part in long-distance cycle races and run several marathons .
sentences.chinese: 他曾参加过远程自行车赛和好几个马拉松赛。

definition: ultramarathon/abbr. for 超級馬拉松|超级马拉松[chao1 ji2 ma3 la1 song1]
race of several days/many day competition
horse race/to ride a horse at a fast pace/wet dream
to start running/the start of a race
